pr_title: [Enhancement] Manual Result based on Automatic Result + Enable Result score > 100% for all Exercises types

timeline.message: connect automatic feedback to manual result
add also test case names to result dialog
make the check on server instead of client
set feedback positive if credits are positive

timeline.bodyText:
This is the score/credits for failed test cases. I added this here as I was not sure if it is better to add it somewhere at the updateResult method of ProgrammingExerciseGradingService.java
@kloessst @schultek what do you think?
timeline.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: We could set the credits by default to 0 when the feedback is created, however the client check would still be needed for existing feedback / existing exercises so i think this is fine.
replies.author: schultek

replies.bodyText: But why are you rounding the credits??
replies.author: schultek

replies.bodyText: @schultek I rounded it because I got e.g. 0,97884545  for a positive automatic feedback
replies.author: fde312

replies.bodyText:
But if we round the credits per automatic feedback, it no longer obeys the grading scheme defined in the test case and SCA section. This would make 0.51... into 1.0 and 0.49... into 0.0, right? I think this does not reflect fair grading and rounding already caused us enough trouble during the PGdP and EidI exams. My recommendation would be to just leave it as precise as possible, and maybe only display it better (or cut off / round up at some place far behind the dot).
I don't think this will be much of a problem because very often the programming exercises never had "nice" credit number.
replies.author: MaisiKoleni

replies.bodyText: Yes rounding would lead to a wrong result, but as @MaisiKoleni suggested you could just display a rounded number.
replies.author: schultek

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Unfortunately its not that easy 😅. With the extended score calculation with bonus points, sca penalties and max penalties we cannot just add the feedback credits to get the overall points. Also the score is in percent. I think we should let the server do the calculation here.
timeline.author: schultek

replies.bodyText: We discussed this and this is fine for now. We will address this in a later PR.
replies.author: schultek

timeline.message: move calculation for structuredGradingInstruction to own service and enable results > 100% for all exercise types
add own calculation for the total score for programming exercises
check if bonus points are null
include right calculation also for client
cap total score to max score also in client

Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into enhancement/programming-assessment/manual-result-based-on-automatic

timeline.bodyText: Could this be simplified to return this.type != FeedbackType.AUTOMATIC. The null case is already covered by the second conditional.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: You are right, then I will remove this and just do this.type != FeedbackType.AUTOMATIC.
replies.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: Done in 217c9f209
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Why do you expect that one more result is updated? I don't see where the setup was changed.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: The createTestParticipations method creates a manual result. See line ProgrammingExerciseGradingServiceTest:572. Therefore the REST Call returns the size of 7.
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: What is the plus doing here?
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: toFixed()converts it to a string and the + just converts it back to a number
replies.author: fde312

replies.bodyText: Cool didn't know that
replies.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: Could you use feedback.type == FeedbackType.AUTOMATIC instead of a double negation.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: Done in 217c9f209

timeline.bodyText: I think I've seen this exact calculation also in the client gradingCriterionService. Could this be unified somehow? I guess it was always like this.

replies.bodyText: See general comment.
replies.author: fde312

timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: If the parameter totalScore is always zero, then it doesn't make sense to have it as a parameter. I would suggest to remove it from the signature and provide it as a local variable.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: No, it is also summed up from the Class where it is called from. Fixed the description
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: It seems a bit off to calculate the score again for manual assessments in this method. The method should just update the result String and do nothing else.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: The problem was that the result score calculation just included the automatic feedback, so it was falsely calculated in case of a manual result. Therefore I recalculated it like it is done for the Assessment.
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Double negation. Could probably check for FeedbackType.AUTOMATIC

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -295,8 +313,8 @@ private void createFeedbackForNotExecutedTests(Result result, Set<ProgrammingExe
      */
     private void removeFeedbacksForAfterDueDateTests(Result result, Set<ProgrammingExerciseTestCase> testCasesForCurrentDate) {
         // Find feedback which is not associated with test cases for the current date. Does not remove static code analysis feedback
-        List<Feedback> feedbacksToFilterForCurrentDate = result.getFeedbacks().stream().filter(
-                feedback -> !feedback.isStaticCodeAnalysisFeedback() && testCasesForCurrentDate.stream().noneMatch(testCase -> testCase.getTestName().equals(feedback.getText())))
+        List<Feedback> feedbacksToFilterForCurrentDate = result.getFeedbacks().stream().filter(feedback -> !feedback.isStaticCodeAnalysisFeedback()
+                && !feedback.isNotAutomaticFeedback() && testCasesForCurrentDate.stream().noneMatch(testCase -> testCase.getTestName().equals(feedback.getText())))

replies.bodyText: Done in 217c9f209
replies.author: fde312

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we need a bigger refactoring here. Instead of having an all in one updateResult method which gets more and more complex because it has to handle all kinds of different feedback, we create a updateManualResult method. This could also solve the problem that updateResultString triggers yet another calculation for the manual case. This might be out of scope of this PR.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: I think that @schultek wanted to adapt the calculation anyways. Maybe we can do the refactoring then or in a follow up after that :)
replies.author: fde312

timeline.message: remove not needed method and do simple check

timeline.bodyText: You should cap this again to maxPoints, as you did in the tutor-assessment-container line 442
timeline.author: schultek

replies.bodyText: @schultek This is done, but in the submitResult call which is done in line 72 (after this calculation). Then in the submitResult call we call a different calculateTotalScore method see AssessementService.java:227 and there we cap it to the maxScore.
